intro: Idothearia villosa, commonly known as the hairy cushion plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to South Africa. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that features dense, woolly foliage, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
